text: ladies please hit me in welcoming home
literally the util e former President
Bill Clinton landed in California this
morning with two American journalists he
helped free from North Korea was an
emotional scene he has the families of
the two journalists wrap them in hugs
and greeted them there was another
interesting hug as well between Bill
Clinton and Al Gore his former vice
president who is the co-founder of the
media company for which the two
journalists work it was a very
interesting moment when the two partners
from the 1990s who have had their screen
estranged moments got back together in a
very emotional moment Al Gore has
actually spent much of the last few
months working intensively on getting
his reporters out of North Korea it
speaks well of our country that when two
American citizens are in harm's way that
so many people would just put things
aside and just go to work to to make
sure that this has had a happy ending he
even offered to go to a Korea himself if
that would help both Korea said no they
wanted Bill Clinton no one less in the
statue of former president so gore
called his former boss 10 days ago or so
and asked him if he would make the trip
Clinton said yes as long as the Obama
administration was happy with that and
after testing it out deciding whether it
was a good idea the White House said yes
please do make that trip I think I think
this obviously puts goers media company
a little bit more on the spotlight we'll
see whether they can use that to build a
more robust and that you know
influential television operation out of
it Gore's now obviously started his
career as a newspaper reporter he's now
on the later side of his career as a
media executive it's kind of an
interesting narrative arc for him this
is a story that's going to be
captivating people for a while and one
of the things people to look at is what
does this mean for Bill Clinton back on
the international stage he finally got
to go to North Korea something he wanted
to do at the end of his presidency but
couldn't and once again now showing here
six months into the era of Obama that he
still has
a role to play that he still can be an
important figure in international
diplomacy he's opened a new channel in
effect to North Korea which has been
obviously at odds with Washington now
for the last number of years over its
nuclear program and while that was not
the official purpose of this mission the
White House stresses it was a private
humanitarian trip clearly this is going
to alter or change the atmosphere as the
new and Bob administration tries to
convince North Korea to come back to the
table and renew its commitment to
getting rid of its nuclear weapons
program when we walked through the doors
we saw standing before us President Bill
Clinton
